instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message:
Hi, hope you guys are doing great.

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had corossion in the USB C connector area, around <TRANSISTOR>Q7680</TRANSISTOR> and on pins 37, 39 and 41 of J6700.

After cleaning and replacing several caps and resistors the machine now turns on to the connect a bluetooth mouse and keyboard screen. Every voltage on J6700 is present except for <SIGNAL>SPI_TPAD_3V3_CLK</SIGNAL> (0v)  and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_TPAD_FLT</SIGNAL> is 12.56 instead of the 13.1 on the schematic.

I dont have a keyboard flex cable at hand to test it out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No keyboard & Trackpad
threads.message: You should test with known good trackpad flex/board.
